edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog

Class CourseCatalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog.CourseCatalog

  • public class CourseCatalog
extends java.lang.Object
    CourseCatalog maintains a SortedList of all Courses that may be scheduled, and provides methods to manipulated list including add, remove, and load from file.
    Author:
    Nick Garner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private edu.ncsu.csc216.collections.list.SortedList<Course> catalog
      SortedList to contain courses for scheduling

      • catalog

        private edu.ncsu.csc216.collections.list.SortedList<Course> catalog
        SortedList to contain courses for scheduling

    • Constructor Detail

      • CourseCatalog

        public CourseCatalog()
        Constructs an empty CourseCatalog object

    • Method Detail

      • newCourseCatalog

        public void newCourseCatalog()
        Creates an empty course catalog. All courses in the previous list are lost unless saved by the user.

      • loadCoursesFromFile

        public void loadCoursesFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs the course catalog by reading in course information from given file. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the file cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File containing the courses to be loaded
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When given file cannot be read

      • addCourseToCatalog

        public boolean addCourseToCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String section,
                                  int credits,
                                  java.lang.String instructorId,
                                  int enrollmentCap,
                                  java.lang.String meetingDays,
                                  int startTime,
                                  int endTime)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a Course manually to the catalog. Returns true if the course was successfully added and false if the course was unable to be added because it matched an existing course in name and section.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of course to add
        title - Title of course to add
        section - Section of course to add
        credits - Number of credits of course to add
        instructorId - Unity ID of instructor of course to add
        enrollmentCap - Max number of students that can be enrolled in Course
        meetingDays - Days that the course to be added meets
        startTime - Starting time of the course to be added in 24hr format
        endTime - Ending time of the course to be added in 24hr format
        Returns:
        True if successfully added, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When course to add cannot be created due to violated constructor constraints

      • removeCourseFromCatalog

        public boolean removeCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String section)
        Removes course with matching name and section from catalog. Returns true if removed, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of course to remove
        section - Section of course to remove
        Returns:
        True if removed, false otherwise

      • getCourseFromCatalog

        public Course getCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String section)
        Searches catalog for course with matching name and section and returns that course object.
        Parameters:
        name - Course name to search
        section - Course section to search
        Returns:
        Returns course if found, otherwise returns null

      • getCourseCatalog

        public java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()
        Returns all courses in the catalog as a 2D string array with columns for name, section, title, and meeting information.
        Returns:
        2D String array containing name, section, title, and meeting information for all course in catalog.

      • saveCourseCatalog

        public void saveCourseCatalog(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves courses in catalog to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of file to save course catalog to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If file cannot be written to
